indications:
Indications to extend life in patients with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, initiated
by specialists experienced in the management of motor neurone disease
name: RILUZOLE
breadcrumbs: 4.9 Drugs used in parkinsonism and related disorders
4.9.3 Drugs used in essential tremor, chorea, tics, and related disorders
cautions:
Cautions history of abnormal hepatic function
(consult product literature for details)Blood disorders Patients or their
carers should be told how to recognise signs of neutropenia and advised
to seek immediate medical attention if symptoms such as fever occur; white blood cell counts should be determined in febrile
illness; neutropenia requires discontinuation of riluzoleInterstitial lung disease Perform
chest radiography if symptoms such as dry cough or dyspnoea develop; discontinue if interstitial lung disease is diagnosedDriving Dizziness or vertigo may
affect performance of skilled tasks (e.g. driving)
doses: 50 mg twice daily; child not recommended
